The customer support response time is abysmal, and when they do respond, it's usually not helpful.

general: This is the worst experience I've had with a code editor. The UI is clunky and unintuitive, making even simple tasks frustrating. I tried integrating it with my existing tools, but the process was a nightmare—nothing worked as documented. The API documentation is either outdated or completely missing key details, leaving me stuck for hours. And don't even get me started on the pricing model. Why am I paying for extensions that barely function? Customer support took days to respond, and their solution was basically 'try reinstalling.' Unacceptable.

general: VS Code is decent for lightweight tasks, but I find myself constantly battling with extensions that don't integrate well. The UI is clean, but the lack of built-in features forces me to rely on third-party plugins, which can be hit or miss.
pros: Clean UI, fast performance, good for quick edits.
cons: Extension integration can be unreliable, some core features missing without plugins.

general: I switched to VS Code because everyone raves about it, but I'm not entirely sold. The customization is great, but the learning curve for some features is steeper than I expected. Customer support response time is also slower than I'd like when I've had issues.
pros: Highly customizable, good for multiple languages.
cons: Steep learning curve for advanced features, slow support responses.

general: It's a solid editor, but the API documentation is lacking in some areas. I've spent more time than I'd like digging through forums to figure out how to use certain features. The pricing model for some extensions is also confusing—why pay for something that should be basic?
pros: Lightweight, good for remote development.
cons: Poor API documentation, confusing pricing for extensions.

general: VS Code is fine for basic coding, but I wouldn't rely on it for complex projects. The UI is intuitive, but the integration capabilities with some tools are limited. I often have to switch to another IDE for more advanced debugging.
pros: Intuitive UI, fast startup.
cons: Limited integration with some tools, not ideal for complex projects.

general: I use VS Code because my team does, but it's not my favorite. The extension marketplace is overwhelming, and some of the most useful ones come with a price tag. The free version is good, but I feel like I'm missing out on key features.
pros: Good for collaboration, lightweight.
cons: Too many paid extensions, can feel limited without them.

general: The editor is fast and easy to use, but the customer support is almost nonexistent. I had an issue with a critical extension, and it took days to get a response. For a tool this widely used, I expected better.
pros: Fast, easy to set up.
cons: Poor customer support, slow response times.

general: VS Code is great for quick edits and small projects, but the UI feels cluttered when you have too many extensions installed. I wish there was a better way to manage them without slowing down the editor.
pros: Good for small projects, fast performance.
cons: UI gets cluttered with extensions, can slow down over time.

general: I like the simplicity of VS Code, but the API documentation is not beginner-friendly. I've had to rely on community forums more than I'd like, which isn't ideal when you're trying to meet a deadline.
pros: Simple, lightweight, good for beginners.
cons: API documentation is not beginner-friendly, relies too much on community help.

general: It's a solid editor, but the integration with some cloud services is lacking. I've had issues with syncing settings across devices, which is frustrating when you're working on multiple machines.
pros: Good for local development, fast.
cons: Poor cloud integration, settings sync issues.

general: VS Code is fine, but it's not as powerful as some other IDEs I've used. The UI is clean, but the lack of built-in tools means I'm constantly installing extensions, which can be a hassle.
pros: Clean UI, good for basic tasks.
cons: Lacks built-in tools, relies too much on extensions.

general: I use VS Code for work because it's what the team uses, but I'm not a fan. The UI is okay, but the integration with our version control system is clunky. I've had to manually fix issues more times than I can count.
pros: Good for team collaboration, lightweight.
cons: Clunky version control integration, manual fixes required often.

general: The editor is fast and easy to use, but the pricing model for some extensions is ridiculous. Why should I pay for features that should be standard? It's a bit of a turn-off.
pros: Fast, easy to use.
cons: Unfair pricing for extensions, some features should be free.

general: I like the customization options, but the UI can get overwhelming with too many extensions. I wish there was a better way to organize them without sacrificing performance.
pros: Highly customizable, good for multiple languages.
cons: UI gets overwhelming, performance can suffer with too many extensions.

general: VS Code is fine for basic coding, but the integration with some tools is lacking. I often have to switch to another IDE for more advanced debugging, which is a hassle.
pros: Good for basic tasks, fast.
cons: Limited integration with some tools, not ideal for advanced debugging.

general: VS Code is decent for lightweight tasks, but I've run into issues with its integration capabilities. The UI is clean, but some features feel half-baked. Customer support response time is also a bit slow when you actually need help.
pros: Lightweight, clean UI, good for basic coding tasks.
cons: Integration capabilities are lacking, slow customer support.

general: I was really excited to try VS Code, but the API documentation is confusing. It took me forever to figure out how to set up some basic extensions. The pricing model for some plugins is also a bit unclear—are they free or not?
pros: Fast and easy to install, lots of extensions available.
cons: Poor API documentation, confusing pricing for plugins.

general: VS Code gets the job done, but it’s not my go-to IDE. The UI/UX design is functional but feels a bit cluttered with all the extensions. I wish there was a better way to organize the workspace.
pros: Fast performance, lots of customization options.
cons: UI can get cluttered, workspace organization needs improvement.

general: I’ve been using VS Code for a few months now, and while it’s great for quick edits, I wouldn’t rely on it for heavy development. The customer support is almost non-existent, and the integration with some tools is hit or miss.
pros: Quick loading time, good for small projects.
cons: Poor customer support, inconsistent tool integration.

general: VS Code is okay, but I’ve had better experiences with other IDEs. The UI is simple, but some features are buried under too many menus. Also, the pricing model for certain extensions is confusing—some are free, some aren’t, and it’s not always clear.
pros: Simple and lightweight, good for beginners.
cons: Features are hard to find, unclear pricing for extensions.

general: I switched to VS Code because everyone raves about it, but I’m not sold. The API documentation is lacking, and I’ve spent more time troubleshooting than coding. The UI is fine, but it’s not as intuitive as I hoped.
pros: Popular with a large community, lots of extensions.
cons: Poor API documentation, not very intuitive.

general: VS Code is a solid editor that covers most of my needs, though it does have a few quirks. The UI is clean and intuitive, but I wish some advanced features were more accessible.
pros: Great UI/UX design, excellent integration capabilities with Git and other tools.
cons: Some advanced features require digging into settings, and the API documentation could be more detailed.

general: I love how lightweight and fast VS Code is compared to other IDEs. It's perfect for quick edits and larger projects alike.
pros: Fast performance, great extensions, and a very responsive interface.
cons: Occasionally, the autocomplete can be a bit slow, and I've had minor issues with some integrations.

general: This is my go-to editor for almost everything. The customization options are fantastic, and the community support is top-notch.
pros: Highly customizable, great community plugins, and excellent customer support response time.
cons: The initial setup can be overwhelming for new users, and some features feel buried in menus.

general: VS Code has improved my workflow significantly. The built-in terminal and Git integration are game-changers.
pros: Built-in terminal, seamless Git integration, and a very active extension marketplace.
cons: The pricing model for some premium extensions is a bit steep, and the UI can feel cluttered with too many extensions.

general: I switched from another IDE to VS Code and haven't looked back. It's lightweight yet powerful, and the extensions make it incredibly versatile.
pros: Lightweight, powerful extensions, and great for both beginners and experts.
cons: Some extensions can slow it down, and the default settings aren't always optimal for every language.

general: VS Code is almost perfect, but there are a few things that could be better. The autocomplete is great, but sometimes it suggests irrelevant options.
pros: Excellent autocomplete, great for debugging, and very easy to use.
cons: Autocomplete can be hit or miss, and the UI could use some polish in certain areas.

general: I've been using VS Code for years, and it keeps getting better. The team is very responsive to feedback, and the updates are frequent and meaningful.
pros: Frequent updates, responsive team, and a very active community.
cons: Some updates introduce bugs, and the documentation for new features can be lacking.

general: VS Code is a fantastic editor, but it's not without its flaws. The integration with some tools isn't as smooth as I'd like.
pros: Great for web development, excellent extensions, and very customizable.
cons: Integration with some tools can be clunky, and the UI can feel overwhelming at times.

general: I use VS Code daily, and it's been a great experience overall. The only downside is that some features require a bit of configuration.
pros: Daily driver, great performance, and excellent for debugging.
cons: Some features require manual setup, and the API documentation could be more comprehensive.

general: VS Code is my favorite editor, but I wish it had better support for certain languages out of the box.
pros: Great for most languages, excellent extensions, and very user-friendly.
cons: Some languages require additional setup, and the UI could be more intuitive for new users.

general: I love how VS Code handles large projects. It's fast and reliable, but the learning curve for some features is steep.
pros: Handles large projects well, fast and reliable, and great for collaboration.
cons: Steep learning curve for advanced features, and some integrations are not straightforward.

general: VS Code is a powerful tool, but it can be a bit overwhelming for beginners. The documentation is helpful, but it's not always easy to find what you need.
pros: Powerful features, great for advanced users, and excellent community support.
cons: Overwhelming for beginners, and the documentation could be better organized.

general: VS Code is a solid choice for any developer. It's lightweight, fast, and has all the features I need. The only downside is that some integrations require extra setup.

cons: Some integrations require extra setup, and the UI can feel cluttered with too many extensions.

general: I've been using VS Code for a while now, and it's been a great experience. The only issue I've had is with some extensions not working as expected.

general: VS Code is a fantastic editor, but it's not perfect. The autocomplete is great, but it can be slow at times, and the UI could use some polish.

general: I love VS Code for its simplicity and power. It's easy to use, but some advanced features require a bit of learning.

general: VS Code is my go-to editor for all my projects. It's fast, reliable, and has a great community. The only downside is that some integrations can be tricky.

general: I've been using VS Code for years, and it's been a great experience. The team is very responsive, and the updates are frequent and meaningful.
